title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Lincoln

content.rendered:
Lincoln is the capital city of Nebraska state and the seat of Lancaster County. It is the economic and cultural hub of the Lincoln Metropolitan and Lincoln-Beatrice Combined Statistical Areas. The city is home to a growing tech sector and service and manufacturing industries as well. Also home to the University of Nebraska, it is a great city to call home. If you are looking for cheap rooms for rent in Lincoln, read on to learn about average rent in Lincoln and more!

Getting to know Lincoln

Originally a prairie covered with buffalo grass, Lincoln was first inhabited by the Pawnee tribe. It was founded in 1856 as the village of Lancaster and became the county seat of Lancaster County. Renamed after President Abraham Lincoln, it is also the seat of government for the state of Nebraska. Lincoln experiences a humid continental climate as it is far from any major water bodies. It was also designated as a refugee-friendly city due to its stable economy, educational institutions, and industries.

Find Rooms For Rent in Lincoln, NE

Related: What Is A Micro Apartment, and Why You Should Learn More

Finding rooms for rent Lincoln

Lincoln is the second-largest city in the state of Nebraska and has a population of 289,102. The city covers 96.194 square miles with some neighborhoods being small towns that Lincoln annexed. Lincoln has 45 registered neighborhood associations with the Downtown area seeing rapid growth recently. With a growing demand for houses, it has become harder to find cheap rooms for rent in Lincoln.

Top neighborhoods in Lincoln

  • Colonial Hills: This is a great place to find rooms for rent in Lincoln with affordable rent and amenities and a safe environment. It is also home to Colonial Hills Park, a great place to enjoy nature or enjoy outdoor events.
  • Porter Ridge: Porter Ridge is one of the smallest neighborhoods in Lincoln. It is known for being safe, and is a great place to find cheap rooms for rent in Lincoln. With a small population, it has a community feel and is a great place for families too.
  • Near South: The Near South is a diverse neighborhood with many historic buildings and churches. It is home to great restaurants, pubs, and other options for dining as well. The culture and great public transportation make it a popular neighborhood. Hence, Near South is a great place to find rooms for rent in Lincoln.

Related: What Is A Micro Apartment, and Why You Should Learn More

Average rent in Lincoln

University life in Lincoln

Lincoln can be a great place to study as it is an educational and economic hub. It is a major hub of the service and manufacturing industries. If you are looking for rooms for rent in Lincoln to study, there are great options for higher education in the city. You can even take up campus accommodation or find cheap rooms for rent in Lincoln. Here are the living costs, top universities, and average rent in Lincoln.

Top Universities in Lincoln:

  • University of Nebraska-Lincoln
  • Nebraska Wesleyan University
  • Union College
  • Southeast Community College
  • Bryan College of Health Sciences

Related: Is Life In Co-Living Communities Right For Me?

Average cost of living in Lincoln

Related: Is Life In Co-Living Communities Right For Me?

How transit-friendly is Lincoln?

1. Airports in Lincoln

The Lincoln Municipal Airport offers connectivity to Denver, Chicago, Minneapolis and some other cities. The Eppley Airfield Airport, Omaha also offers connectivity to Lincoln and can be reached by shuttle bus. The latter option can often be a cheaper way to get to the city.

2. Taxis in Lincoln

You can easily use taxis in Lincoln and they are generally safe and convenient. Taxi rates in Lincoln are generally lower than in most cities. Ride-sharing apps like Uber and Lyft are also available. They can be great if you are looking for rooms for rent in Lincoln in an out-of-the-way area.

3. Buses in Lincoln

StarTran operates the public bus transit system in Lincoln. Individual fares are $1.75 and monthly passes are $45. You can check the routes and timings for Star Tran buses online. Be sure to check for stops when you are looking for rooms for rent in Lincoln.

4. Cycling in Lincoln

Lincoln has an extensive cycling trail system that extends throughout the city. You can also make use of the bike-share program to get around. You can easily travel across the city in an hour or less. Cycling can be a great way option if you are looking for rooms for rent in Lincoln and have a short commute.

Related: Decorating Your Off-Campus Housing Or Apartment On A Budget

Cultural activities in Lincoln

University of Nebraska State Museum:

This is the state’s premier museum of natural history and a University-based research museum as well. The museum aims to discover and disseminate knowledge about the natural world. This is a must-visit for those with an interest in natural history when looking for rooms for rent in Lincoln.

Nebraska State Capitol:

This building is home to the state legislature of Nebraska and an example of Art Deco architecture. The interior art provides a representation of the history of Nebraska, its government, and its people. There is also an observation deck on the 14th floor that provides views of the entire city.

Sunken Gardens:

Sunken Gardens was a Depression-era project, built in 1930. Originally known as the ‘Rock Garden’, it is home to over 416 trees and shrubs. This is a great place to visit for a weekend nature getaway if you are looking for rooms for rent in Lincoln.

Related: Questions You Need To Ask Your Potential Roommate Before Saying Yes

We’ve got your back!

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Lincoln? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!
